This game is HIGHLY overlooked by its free to play sequel, Team Fortress 2. It is a little hard to find a lot of people to play the game with, but when you though, this game can be really fun! This game is a charming little shooter, and is quite straight to the point. Each character is set up to be balanced with their own unique abilities. There is no unfare/overpowered/exploited characters, it is completely balanced, and is not about the stats. This is a game that I can simply pick up and play a round or two. I love this games and I think more people should try it. The graphics may be a little outdated, but the gameplay is just as good as a modern game.  If you like a good first person shooter without screaming 12 year olds and fair gameplay, then I recommend this hidden gem to you!

This is an amazing game. You just have to know that if you treat it like Team Fortress 2, you're gonna have a bad time! This game is significantly different than Team Fortress 2. It has a more competitive, fast-paced feeling where people try to work together to complete the objective. If you're used to Team Fortress 2, you have to know some differences before you get in game, get your ass wooped then go to write a negative review about this. 

Scouts are not designed for combat and are just for completing the objective. Getting a single kill as a scout is hard to do.  I personally like this scout concept over the Team Fortress 2 one. The people that still want a fast combat class in the game, don't worry! There's still a class for that. Recently, Team Fortress 2 got a new rifle called the 'Classic'. If you know how that works, you can grasp the concept of the classic sniper pretty well. Although, the TFC sniper does not suck as much as the classic. Soldier is the same except he has two shotguns. On the topic of shotguns, there are two of them. A double-barreled one that does more damage yet a slower fire rate and a slower reload and a single-barreled one that does more damage yet a faster fire rate and a faster reload. Shotguns in this game have no fall-off.

Demoman is pretty similar. Your pipebomb launcher is your stickybomb launcher as Team Fortress 2 players are used to. Except the pipeboms do not stick. You have a single-barreled shotgun and you can place an instakill detpack that explodes in 5, 20, 50 seconds. The detpack can also be used to open entrances. Medic is the most changed class. Medic is for combat, healing, and capturing objectives. Your medkit can infect enemies and you have two shotguns. You also have a conc grenade that you can use to conc jump which we'll go over later. HWGuy has the same difference as soldier. You still have a minigun, but you have two shotguns.

Pyro is weaker than his Team Fortress 2 counterpart. Your main job is to confuse and it is not to wreck. You have an incendiary RPG and you cannot airblast. Spy is the second most different when compared to his Team Fortress 2 counterpart. You have a double-barreled shotgun, a pistol that slows enemies down, and a nailgun. You can disguise still and you can do a crappy feign death that makes you turn into a corpse. No one falls for it and it doesn't even show up in the killfeed. It's good for hiding yet it sucks for tricking. YES BACKSTABS STILL EXIST. Engineer is pretty similar. You cannot upgrade dispensers and teleporters, but you can upgrade sentry guns. Sentry guns can be upgraded in 1 hit as long as you have 130 cells (metal). You also have a weak railgun that's more for finishing off rather than taking on a full health target. Dispensers only give armor and ammo, but no health.

General Differences: 

There are grenades. Grenades. Every Team Fortress Classic class has a frag grenade (except scout), and a special grenade. Scout has two special grenades.

Movement is a lot more intricate. You can jump with grenades and bunnyhop. 

There are more gamemodes and maps.

On flag capturing maps, you don't take the flag back to your flag and you take it to somewhere else.

There is armor.
Nice game.

I could go eather way with this game so im just going to write down whats good and whats bad about it its nothing like team fortress i can say that much...how did team fortress classic get from that to team fortress 2? maybe we will find out when hl3 comes out
good things: its fun and exciting,its not like any other game you have seen, shit gets real in it,you can pee in urinals,its like new maps then tf2,its a nice change of pace

mid things: it has granades....vary annoying granades...but granades, its like a michael bay version of a video game,its not like team fortress 2, you can team kill (its in mid because if you have that one guy who you think is a dick you can wipe him/her out,sticky bombs bounce all over the place before stopping (would be on bad but you get the hang of it fast),it is like half life but in team fortress form with the armor the hud and the weapons, you can carry much more weapons then you can in team fortress,why do we need two shotguns? i have no clue

bad things: there is no training like in tf2 so the new players have no idea what to do or how to play, the granades are annoying as fuck, you die fast,if you get poisened you cant get rid of it unless a medic heals you once more annoying it has some call of duty physics in it, there are no medikits around you have to walk your ass back to base or find a medic, the controlls are hard to learn,you have no idea if you are doing something right or not, there is hardly any people playing even when team killing is off if someone shoots you with a rocket or bomb your still going to the moon, you die even if you change your class in spawn, the ground can get lit on fire so if you walk on that fire you burn to death,if you play pyro it takes people about 4 seconds to light on fire if you use the flametrower,if you go near a person when your poisend or on fire that can pass on to that person, there is no resuppy closet you have to wait for things to spawn to get hp/ammo/armor

chances are i will change this after playing it some more if i do. go ahead hate my guts im just not into it...yet...if i ever do but whatever

13 Years later still the ONLY FPS game on PC that I can actually play for more than 5 mins at a time.  In fact I can play for days at a time.  The speed, control, strategy and overal logic this game uses is pure beauty.  Although it blatantly breaks nearly every realistic law of physics known to man kind, it still easily trumps all of the zombie filled, fantasy land, role-playing nonsense this next generation has grown to obsess over.  It makes no sense how fun and enjoyable this game STILL is, regardless of it being ''dead'' and bereft of nearly all organized play (outside off all of the low-lifes wasting everyones time using Perfect Player packages in the pickups ofc).  You may need to be born before 1990 or so to truly grasp the awesomeness of this game, but if you do, kudos and thank you for playing.  Nuff said.

rufi0

A classic game for the classic gamers. Take a break from all the new fangled fancy FPS and head back to the origins where many ideas from other games evolved from TFC. Inevitably this game is loads of fun, and could fully enravel and further extend your skills at any FPS game. Truly there may be some downsides and even some possibility of not even being able to get on the top 5 but still gives a true 9 class, teamwork background.

Is it worth it? Maybe. Team Fortress 2 is better, free,more items and not dead. But TFC is different. Don't expect to buy this game and play in many servers, it's dead. Some classes are ueless. Scouts useless. Pyro is broken. and B-hoping is annyoing. But it's fun if you just want to play a game casualy. and the grenades suck. Game looks good for Gold Source. But killing people takes to long, but other people can kill you people in easy. and the pub server sucks. To much spam! and the community is terible. Only buy if you are ready to play with few people, and don't get mad quickly!

When I got this for Christmas in 1999 along with Half-Life, I didn't even know what it was. 
When I got home two days later and installed it, my family wouldnt have access to our computer again. 
I used to trade off every 5 deaths or 20 kills with my little brother until the late hours of the night. When I would get in trouble, TFC would be taken away, and I would have to go outside and play. I can still remember my best friends names, though I doubt they still play it. I can even still remember my favorite medic. I remember mulching until I could finally kick the shit out of anyone (this was before stat tracking, though I would assume the hours would be in the thousands.) VIP, Climb, and Jump maps were perfect to kill time and be silly with all your friends. 
Though I havent played since TF2 came out, I miss this game more than anything ever. Definitely the fondest memory I have as a child. This game made me fall in love with Sierra (VALVE), and to know what real FPS's should be like. 
I have purchased this game three times after the initial gift, to install on friends and girlfriends computers so that I could play at their houses. 
Buy this even if it's just to have it in your collection and you never play it. At least you can say that you have it and pretend that you are OG. 
I love you TFC.

When the Quake mod becomes a HL1 gamemode, a lot of Windows opened for the game itself and it's future.  No hats, no unlocks, not even skins.  Just good ol' 2fort, well, and other fun maps to play.

Not a fan of the servers?  With the right AMXmod setup, you could even have your own Singleplayer server with bots.

Competitive?  Join a pickup server and play a 4v4 AvD style.

10/10, Total Classic

This game is average good, not as good as counter strike or day of defeat. But its good when you are in the mood of playing. Servers are dead, but not entirely. Maybe like 2-3 servers still up and running and has people. This game is about objectives such as sending your flag into enemy base or capture the flag. Just remember that everyone has alot of HP (like how it is with half-life basically, but can take more explosives, ALOT).

Update: So after playing this a while now there are some things I'm going to say, but nonetheless I still recommend it because there were actually fun moments when playing this even though despite the servers are pretty much dead but not entirely (as said above), because there are some flaws that can and will make the game boring unless you are interested in this kind of stuff (to me, it doesnt as I just want a regular competitive match). So here are the pros and cons I've seen throughout playing this.

Pros:

There are moments in some servers where Team Based are really Team Based, where you work together with your team whether to get the objective in the enemy base, or grab the objective from the enemy base to your base.

Mods as usual has some fun stuff, I had a blast playing them and it has its moments when that server has people and sometimes its dead. But when theres people, theres the fun. Preferably the mod maps were alot of fun.


Now for cons, and those tend to happen fairly often. I wouldnt say TFC is the worst because otherwise I wouldnt be playing it and would have given a negative review otherwise.

Cons:

Most of the classes are useless in some servers. Mainly due to some classes overusing special grenades that gives them a super boost (such as medic and scout), depending on the servers you play, if you are playing defense you will run into them VERY often, wondering why isnt offense taking care of them. Especially when multiple people comes in.

Bhopping, lets just say I have a love-hate relationship with Bhopping. Times it was fun, times it gets annoying. In this game, depending on servers once again, its annoying. Mainly on flag captures, as people say it takes "Skill". Yeah, thats true. But you know what it can also do? Scare away players, and kill the server. Making it dead (and its not the kind of where the server crashes, its the kind of where you'll end up either playing alone or 2v2, maybe less). Considering the majority of servers are already dead. Unless you love Bhopping, or just want to get into it to make the game balanced. Go for it. To me, its what makes it boring. But nonetheless I still come back and play it.

I cant really say what needs to be fixed considering this is a very old game. But if you love Bhopping, you are welcome here. If you are not, just hope you get good teams or for the very least are good enough to hunt down these bhoppers. Just be aware of overused grenades and use classes that can help tip the balance for the team. There are teams like that, so if its a balanced match, you'll have a fun time.

I can not in good faith recomend an online multiplayer game that has a severe lack of online players to complete the expierience. No matter how fun it may or may not be. And I can't tell for the previous stated reason.
